etymology.description: 工(工) (gōng, "work") + 作(作) (zuò, "to do; to make") combine to mean "work". 人(人) (rén, "person") + 员(員) (yuán, "member; personnel") combine to refer to a "staff member" or "personnel". Thus, 工作人员(工作人員) (gōngzuò rényuán) refers to "working personnel" or "staff member".
etymology.interpretation: 工作人员(工作人員) (gōngzuò rényuán) literally means people who are engaged in a specific task or project as part of their employment. This reflects the structured nature of roles within organizations or projects.

examples.chinese: 会议现场有许多工作人员(會議現場有許多工作人員)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì xiànchǎng yǒu xǔduō gōngzuò rényuán.
examples.english: There are many staff members at the conference venue.

examples.chinese: 会议开始前(會議開始前)，工作人员检查设备(工作人員檢查設備)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì kāishǐ qián, gōngzuò rényuán jiǎnchá shèbèi.
examples.english: Before the meeting began, the staff checked the equipment.

examples.chinese: 火车站大厅里有工作人员提供信息(火車站大廳裡有工作人員提供信息)。
examples.pinyin: Huǒchēzhàn dàtīng lǐ yǒu gōngzuò rényuán tígōng xìnxī.
examples.english: At the train station hall, staff provide information.
